net.sourceforge.taglets.impl.digraph
Class Digraph

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.taglets.impl.digraph.Digraph
Direct Known Subclasses:
TagletSorter
public class Digraph
extends Object

Digraph that allows topological sorting of values.

Warning:

The digraph is destroyed after the sort operation, see sort().

Version:
1.7 (2008/03/30 12:43:21)
Maintainer:
Bruno Essmann <essmann@sourceforge.net>
Since:
1.5.0

          The set of arcs present in this digraph.

          The nodes set of this digraph.

Method Detail

sort

public String[] sort()
              throws CyclicException
Topologically sorts this digraph.

Warning:

The digraph will be destroyed in the sorting process.

Returns:
the topologically sorted values of this digraph.
Throws:
CyclicException - if this digraph contains a cycle, the message of the exception describes the cycle.
Since:
1.5.0

getCycleMessage

protected String getCycleMessage()
Returns a message describing the cycles present in this digraph.

Returns:
a message describing the cycles present in this digraph.
Since:
1.5.0

add

public void add(String from,
                String to)
Adds an arc for the specified origin and destination values to the digraph.

Parameters:
from - the origin value.
to - the destination value.
Since:
1.5.0

addNode

protected Node addNode(String value)
Adds a node for the specified value to this digraph.

Warning:

If a node with an equivalent value is already contained the existing node is returned without modifying the node set.

Parameters:
value - the value for the node to add.
Returns:
the node added or an already existing node with the same value.
See Also:
getNode(String)
Since:
1.5.0

getNode

protected Node getNode(String value)
Returns the node for the specified value contained in the digraph.

Parameters:
value - the value for which to retrieve the node.
Returns:
the node or null if there is no such node contained.
Since:
1.5.0

isEmpty

protected boolean isEmpty()
Checks if there are any nodes in the digraph.

Returns:
true if the digraph contains nodes, false otherwise.

Returns the next minimal node found.
